Description: Plaster upper mould for a lamp with a grooved notched handle, a plain discus, and shoulder-volutes. The upper shoulder has a row of plant-pattern, now worn and blurred. The mould has four registration-sockets, and is also marked for registration on each side, two vertical grooves on the right, and a divided triangle on the left side. The underside is rough.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1958.bis)
